page.title: 15ALLARBURN FARM
page.content:
Allarburn Farm
Allarburn Farm, just west of Elgin, has been owned by the Taylor family since 1923. It keeps 60 milking cows and 90 younger ones, Guernseys. About 120 gallons of milk per day go to the Allarburn Dairy Ltd. Along with milk from other farms this is delivered in Elgin and in the smaller towns and villages within a radius of 15 miles. Allarburn also keeps hens - 18500 of them. They lay about 75000 eggs each week. Three men are employed to look after the cows and four full-time and three part-time to look after the hens.
